name: Bricks starter kit
description:
BRICKS is a Figma Design System Starter Kit based on MUI, to be used along side Backlight.dev Starter Kit BRICKS

This library is using Figma Tokens plugin and it has been set up with all tokens matching the code side. It also makes use of the free components made available at MUI For Figma.


Features

- ♻️ Open source

- 🎨 Tokens-based theming system

- 🌗 Dark mode support

- 🔥 7 components already linked to Backlight.dev

- 🔗 Links to the documentation in code

- 📚 Interactive documentation


Design Tokens

BRICKS uses Figma Tokens plugin to organise and manage all the Design Tokens as seen in code.

It is also documented for it to be visually discoverable, with links to the coded documentation.


Components

BRICKS comes with 7 components to get started, in the most basic categories.


Usage


For Designers: Duplicate this Figma file


1- Duplicate this file for your own usage.

2- Update your Design Token using the Figma Tokens 3- plugin.

3- Modify the components as needed.

4- Create new components.

5- Enjoy 🥳


Make sure to go back to your team's Design System in Backlight and update the links tin the design tab to your new file.


For Developers: Getting Started in Backlight (recommended)


This is the recommended way, as Backlight gives you an all-in-one Design system platform.


In order to create your own project from this Starter Kit using Backlight, and sign up or log in if you already have an account. Make sure you have a workspace, then go to the Backlight starter-kits list and click the **BRICKS** card. It will create a project based on this starter kit for you.


Documentation


Design System Documentation


BRICKS is shipped with a good documentation basis which starts in the introduction and then walks you through the usage of tokens and components.

Just open it and start exploring!
